API Reference

Services Package

The services package contains all linting services following Single Responsibility Principle.

LintOrchestrator

LintOrchestrator - Coordinates all linting services

class temple_linter.services.lint_orchestrator.LintOrchestrator(logger=None)[source]

Bases: object

Orchestrates the complete linting workflow for templated files.

Workflow: 1. Template linting (syntax and logic validation) 2. Token cleaning (strip DSL tokens) 3. Base linting (delegate to native linters) 4. Diagnostic mapping (map positions back to original) 5. Merge all diagnostics

This orchestrator coordinates services following Single Responsibility Principle: - TemplateLinter: Validates template syntax - TokenCleaningService: Strips DSL tokens - BaseLintingService: Delegates to native linters - DiagnosticMappingService: Maps positions

Parameters:

logger (Logger, default: None)

__init__(logger=None)[source]
Parameters:

logger (Logger, default: None)

lint_template(text, uri, language_client)[source]

Execute complete linting workflow for a templated file.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – Template content

  • uri (str) – Document URI

  • language_client (LanguageClient) – LSP client for base linting delegation

Return type:

List[Diagnostic]

Returns:

Combined list of template and base format diagnostics

TokenCleaningService

TokenCleaningService - Strips template tokens for base format linting

class temple_linter.services.token_cleaning_service.TokenCleaningService[source]

Bases: object

Service responsible for stripping template tokens and tracking text positions.

This service: - Tokenizes template content - Extracts only text tokens (strips DSL tokens) - Tracks original positions for diagnostic mapping

clean_text_and_tokens(text)[source]

Strip template tokens and return cleaned text with position tracking.

Parameters:

text (str) – Original template content

Return type:

Tuple[str, List[Token]]

Returns:

Tuple of (cleaned_text, text_tokens) - cleaned_text: Content with all DSL tokens removed - text_tokens: List of text Token objects for position mapping

BaseLintingService

BaseLintingService - Delegates linting to VS Code’s native linters

class temple_linter.services.base_linting_service.BaseLintingService(logger=None)[source]

Bases: object

Service responsible for delegating base format linting to VS Code extension.

This service: - Sends cleaned content to VS Code extension - Receives diagnostics from native linters (JSON, YAML, etc.) - Handles communication errors gracefully

Parameters:

logger (Logger, default: None)

__init__(logger=None)[source]
Parameters:

logger (Logger, default: None)

request_base_diagnostics(lc, cleaned_text, original_uri)[source]

Request base format diagnostics from VS Code extension.

Parameters:

  • lc (LanguageClient) – Language client for communication

  • cleaned_text (str) – Template content with DSL tokens stripped

  • original_uri (str) – URI of the original document

Return type:

List[Diagnostic]

Returns:

List of diagnostics from base format linters

DiagnosticMappingService

DiagnosticMappingService - Maps diagnostics from cleaned content to original positions

class temple_linter.services.diagnostic_mapping_service.DiagnosticMappingService(logger=None)[source]

Bases: object

Service responsible for mapping diagnostics between cleaned and original content.

This service: - Maps diagnostic positions from cleaned content back to original template - Accounts for stripped DSL tokens in position calculations - Handles edge cases and errors gracefully

Parameters:

logger (Logger, default: None)

__init__(logger=None)[source]
Parameters:

logger (Logger, default: None)

map_diagnostics(diagnostics, text_tokens)[source]

Map diagnostics from cleaned content to original template positions.

Parameters:

  • diagnostics (List[Diagnostic]) – Diagnostics with positions in cleaned content

  • text_tokens (List[Token]) – Text tokens tracking original positions

Return type:

List[Diagnostic]

Returns:

Diagnostics with positions mapped to original template

temple_linter.template_tokenizer.temple_tokenizer(text, delimiters=None)[source]

Yields Token objects for text, statement, expression, and comment regions. Supports custom delimiters.

Template Preprocessing

template_preprocessing.py Utility for stripping/replacing template tokens for base format linting.

temple_linter.template_preprocessing.strip_template_tokens(text, delimiters=None, replace_with='')[source]

Strips or replaces all template tokens from a templated file.

Preserves the base format structure for linting. Supports configurable delimiters.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – The input templated text.

  • delimiters (Dict[str, Tuple[str, str]] | None, default: None) –

    Optional dict specifying delimiters for ‘statement’, ‘expression’, ‘comment’. Example:

    {
    'statement': ('{%','%}'),
    'expression': ('{{','}}'),
    'comment': ('{#','#}')
}

  • replace_with (str, default: '') – String to replace template tokens with (default: ‘’).

Return type:

str

Returns:

Text with template tokens stripped or replaced.

LSP Server

Temple LSP Server - Thin adapter for Language Server Protocol

This server delegates all linting logic to service classes following Single Responsibility Principle. See services/ directory for implementation.

class temple_linter.lsp_server.TempleLinterServer[source]

Bases: LanguageServer

LSP server for temple template linting.

Base Format Linter

Base format linting integration for templated files. Uses template_preprocessing to strip template tokens before linting.

class temple_linter.base_format_linter.BaseFormatLinter(delimiters=None)[source]

detect_base_format(filename, text)[source]

Detect the base format of a templated file using extension and content heuristics. Supported formats: json, yaml, html, toml, xml, md, txt

TODO: Refactor using Strategy pattern with FormatDetectorRegistry See ARCHITECTURE_ANALYSIS.md Work Item #2 for implementation plan

Parameters:

  • text (str)

Return type:

str

lint_base_format(text, filename=None)[source]

Lint the base format of a templated file by stripping template tokens first. Returns diagnostics from the base linter (placeholder).

Parameters:

  • filename (str | None, default: None)
